newsitem.title: PERU: Lima stocks recover again as miners lead.
newsitem.headline: Lima stocks recover again as miners lead.

text.p: The Lima Stock Exchange made light gains overall Wednesday, as polymetallic miners again led the market, brokers said.
They predicted stability or continued gains in the remaining sessions of the week.

According to preliminary figures, the bolsa's General Index .IGRA rose 0.51 percent Wednesday to 2,248.87 points while the blue-chip Selective Index ISEL rose 0.83 percent to 3,244.30. Volume was an improved 64 million soles ($24.3 million) on 2,130 trades.

"The market is basically quiet, although the polymetallic mining sector is starting to show some volatility because the prices have risen a lot and the price of zinc has reached a point of stability in the internatinal market," said Miguel Bondy, of Andino Capital Market brokerage.
Brokers said investors were likely to move into electricity utilities in coming days due to their low prices on expectations of damage from the El Nino weather phenomenon.

Wednesday's chief winner was miner Morococha, which gained 6.48 percent to 9.70 soles, while benchmark Telefonica del Peru saw a 1.88 percent rise to 7.04 soles and Banco de Credito was up 0.41 percent to 2.46 soles.
Overall, 37 stocks fell, 30 rose and 26 were stable.
